title-group.article-title: Correction: Measuring Extremist Archetypes: Scale Development and Validation

license.license-p: This is an open access article distributed under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution License, which permits unrestricted use, distribution, and reproduction in any medium, provided the original author and source are credited.

related-article.article-title: Measuring Extremist Archetypes: Scale Development and Validation

body.p: There are errors in the formatting of Tables 1, 4, 7, 10 and 12; and the values are not aligned properly. In Table 6, the correlation coefficient value in column 10, row 13 is incorrect. The correct value is -.33***. The publisher apologizes for these errors. Please see the correct Tables 1, 4, 6, 7, 10 and 12 below.

caption.title: Factor Loadings for Exploratory Factor Analysis with Direct Oblimin Rotation.

tr.td: 46. I am known as a group member that is not afraid to take any risks.
45. I am known as a group member that is not afraid of facing dangers.
44. I am willing to take more risks than other people in my group.
48. Other group members see me as someone who likes thrills and adventure.
43. I like groups that bring along adventure and adrenaline.
49. I like to show other group members that I am not afraid of taking risks.
15. I try to find a group that accepts me.
19. To belong to a group, I am willing to do what is asked of me.
13. I tend to "go with the flow" in group settings.
40. The group I belong to gives me stability in life.
25. I often join groups that others have introduced me to.
24. I stay in a group as long as they give me what I need.
27. Sometimes, I suddenly decide to leave a group and seek a new one.
35. Throughout my life I have found it difficult to find a group to belong to.
28. It has happened that I just replaced one group I belonged to with another.
23. I rarely stay with one group for a long period of time.
22. I have shifted a lot between groups in my life.
47. I get bored more easily than other group members.
11. Most group members see me as a leader.
1. In a group, I often take the role of a leader.
5. Other group members turn to me for guidance.
4. I often do most of the strategic planning in the group I belong to.
8. I take a central position in the group I belong to.
6. Other group members usually do as I say.
16. I am willing to change my beliefs for the group I belong to.
14. I am willing to do whatever it takes to get my group to accept me.
33. I care little about people outside my group.
17. I put the group first and myself second.
41. Before I became part of my group, I had no clear direction in life.

fn.p: Note. Factor loadings > .40 are boldface. Traveler = Fellow Traveler

caption.title: Hierarchical Multiple Regression Analyses Predicting Violent Behavioral Intentions.
Psychometric Properties and Partial Correlations of the Scales.

fn.p: Note. Potential range for the personality scales are 1–5; the rest range from 1–7. rp = partial correlations. Control variables in the partial correlations are the remaining archetypes. Traveler = Fellow Traveler.

caption.title: Psychometric Properties and Partial Correlations of the Scales.

fn.p: Note. Potential range for the personality scales are 1–5; the rest range from 1–7. rp = partial correlations. Control variables in the partial correlations are the remaining archetypes. Traveler = Fellow Traveler.

caption.title: Psychometric Properties and Partial Correlations Between the Extremist Archetypes and the HEXACO Facets.

fn.p: Note. rp = partial correlations. Control variables in the partial correlations are the remaining four archetypes. p < .05 are in boldface.
aAlpha coefficients are presented for scales with more than two items. Correlation coefficients are presented for two items, *p <.001.

ref.mixed-citation: ObaidiM, SkaarSW, OzerS, KunstJR (2022) Measuring extremist archetypes: Scale development and validation. PLoS ONE 17(7): e0270225. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0270225 35857719
